articles.title: 5 things to know about GLP-1 use in Medicare: KFF
articles.summary: Participating Medicare Part D plans can officially begin covering weight-loss treatment in 2027.  The initiative falls under CMS’ voluntary “Better Approaches to Lifestyle and Nutrition for Comprehensive hEalth” — or BALANCE — model.

articles.title: 14 recent hospital, health system president exits
articles.summary: Several hospital and health system presidents have recently exited their roles, with some retiring and others transitioning to new roles. Hospitals reported at least 50 president exits in 2025.

articles.title: University of Minnesota, Fairview to retire M Health brand under new agreement
articles.summary: The M Health Fairview brand will be phased out in 2027 as part of a broader restructuring between Minneapolis-based Fairview Health Services and the University of Minnesota, Minnesota Star Tribune reported Jan. 30.

articles.title: Flu activity rebounds nationwide after 3-week decline: 5 updates
articles.summary: Flu activity increased nationwide after three weeks of decline, driven in part by rising influenza B activity, according to the CDC’s latest Fluview report.  Although flu-related hospital admissions decreased in the week ending Jan.

articles.title: Mass General Brigham Cancer Institute APPs pursue union vote
articles.summary: Advanced practice providers at the Mass General Brigham Cancer Institute have filed a petition with the National Labor Relations Board seeking to vote on whether to unionize. The petition, filed Jan.

articles.title: Penn State sues insulin makers, PBMs over pricing scheme
articles.summary: The Pennsylvania State University in University Park filed a federal lawsuit Jan. 13 alleging major insulin manufacturers and pharmacy benefit managers artificially inflated the price of insulin nationwide.

articles.title: NYU Langone shakes up its recipe for hospital meals
articles.summary: New York City-based NYU Langone Health has undergone a culinary overhaul with a clear goal: to prove hospital food can be both healthy and delicious. The initiative began in 2014, when health system leaders took a critical look at the quality of food being served and its role in the broader patient experience.

articles.title: The ‘seemingly small’ change with a big effect on VCU Health’s workforce
articles.summary: In 2025, Richmond, Va.-based VCU Health addressed a persistent issue highlighted in employee engagement surveys: parking.

articles.title: STAT+: New rule would force PBMs to disclose drug rebates and other fees
articles.summary: The proposal would mark a significant change for the secretive PBM industry, which often shields crucial data from its clients.

articles.title: Newsom files a civil rights complaint against CMS’ Oz in latest feud with the Trump administration

articles.summary: As more consumers order up lab tests and genetic screenings, experts say it could impact insurance, loans, and employment decisions.

articles.summary: The White House unveiled a new effort to streamline the country’s response to its drug and alcohol epidemic. But the announcement was light on details.

Federal judge determines Luigi Mangione will not face death penalty
articles.summary: A federal judge has tossed two of the federal government's charges against the man accused of murdering a prominent insurance executive, meaning he will no longer face the death penalty.

articles.title: Op-ed: CMS has the opportunity to improve public health data reporting
articles.summary: The time has come for CMS to implement performance measures—or quantitative metrics—for public health and clinical data exchange, writes Sheri Doyle of The Pew Charitable Trusts.

articles.title: CMS issues final rule closing state Medicaid provider tax 'loophole'
articles.summary: Restrictions on "a Medicaid financing gimmick” through which states are able to secure greater funding from the federal government was targeted by the agency, budget hawks and Republican lawmakers during 2025, and has now been finalized.

articles.title: Labor Department proposes rule to force greater PBM transparency
articles.summary: The Department of Labor has issued a proposed rule that aims to inject additional transparency in pharmacy benefit manager relationships.

articles.title: Nourish to offer free lab testing for members to inform nutrition care
articles.summary: Nourish Labs will integrate blood testing into personalized nutrition care. The objective measurement will improve treatment plans and strengthen patient engagement, executives say.
